intro: Pilogyne setosa, commonly known as the hairy pilogyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Pilogyne setosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
